pullrequest.title: Added tests to Event, PIMPL-ized it, and fixed bugs

content.raw:
I agree with number one, but external programs would complain about EventPrivate not being present. Maybe for template classes we have an exception where the Private version lives in the same header file as the parent.

It's okay to have more source files (we already do it with unit tests).

We could use shared pointers, but it was my understanding that data pointers should not be shared. If no other class can get the pointer, then the usefulness of shared pointers dwindles. We only have to make sure to delete the pointer in the class destructor.
